definition: pingshu, a folk art where a single performer narrates stories from history or fiction
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: One of the classic comedies of Sichuanese comedian, Li Boqing…
sentences.chinese: 四川話評書人李伯清的經典散打評書之一。

sentences.english: One of the classic comedies of Sichuanese comedian, Li Boqing…
sentences.chinese: 四川話評書人李伯清的經典散打評書之一。

sentences.english: Lao She's novels have a lot of lessons from the art of the storytelling and surpasses it.
sentences.chinese: 老舍小說對評書藝術有諸多借鑑之處，又有所超越。

sentences.english: Keeping the audience guessing is a common technique in storytelling, the term for it is Liukouzi.
sentences.chinese: 賣關子是評書中常用的手段技巧，術語稱留釦子。

sentences.english: It developed into an independent art form in the early years of the Qing Dynasty (late 17thcentury).
sentences.chinese: 評書作爲一種獨立的說書品種，大約形成於清代初期。

sentences.english: This is according to the original shy naih-an as the shuihu willere.
sentences.chinese: 這部評書是依據施耐庵的原著《水滸》講述。

sentences.english: In grade school, I tried being a Pingshu Master.
sentences.chinese: 小學時曾試過當個評書大師。

definition: ballad tune in southern dialects, usually to sanxian 三弦 or pipa 琵琶 accompaniment
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
